User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the CreatorX SEO platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the user account was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp of when the user account was last updated.

ChannelAccount.title: ChannelAccount
ChannelAccount.description: Represents a YouTube channel or Instagram account linked to a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ChannelAccount entity.

platform.description: The platform of the channel/account (e.g., YouTube, Instagram).

channelId.description: The unique channel ID provided by the platform.

displayName.description: The display name of the channel/account.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the channel/account was linked.

ContentIdea.title: ContentIdea
ContentIdea.description: Represents a content idea generated by the platform.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ContentIdea entity.

category.description: The category of the content idea.

title.description: The title of the content idea.

description.description: A short description of the content idea.

keywords.description: Keywords associated with this content idea

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the content idea was generated.

Keyword.title: Keyword
Keyword.description: Represents a keyword used for SEO research.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Keyword entity.

searchVolume.description: The monthly search volume for the keyword.

difficultyScore.description: The difficulty score for ranking for the keyword.

trendData.description: Trend data for the keyword (e.g., JSON string of monthly search volume).

Competitor.title: Competitor
Competitor.description: Represents a competitor channel or video.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Competitor entity.

url.description: The URL of the competitor channel or video.

channelName.description: The name of the competitor's channel.

avgWatchTime.description: The average watch time of the competitor's videos.

commonTags.description: Common tags used by the competitor.

VideoMetrics.title: VideoMetrics
VideoMetrics.description: Represents metrics for a specific video.

id.description: Unique identifier for the VideoMetrics entity.

videoId.description: The ID of the video on the platform (e.g., YouTube video ID).

impressions.description: The number of impressions for the video.

ctr.description: The click-through rate for the video.

watchTime.description: The total watch time for the video (in seconds).

engagementRate.description: The engagement rate for the video.

rankPositions.description: Ranking positions of the video for tracked keywords (e.g., JSON string of keyword:position pairs).

recordedAt.description: Timestamp of when these metrics where recorded.

TrendEvent.title: TrendEvent
TrendEvent.description: Represents a trending event or topic.

id.description: Unique identifier for the TrendEvent entity.

topic.description: The topic of the trending event.

startTime.description: The start time of the trending event.

endTime.description: The end time of the trending event (if applicable).

relatedKeywords.description: Keywords related to the trending event.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Subscription entity.

planName.description: The name of the subscription plan (e.g., Free, Premium Monthly, Premium Annual).

startDate.description: The start date of the subscription.

endDate.description: The end date of the subscription.

status.description: The status of the subscription (e.g., active, cancelled).

WhatsAppSession.title: WhatsAppSession
WhatsAppSession.description: Represents a WhatsApp session for personalized guidance.

id.description: Unique identifier for the WhatsAppSession entity.

sessionId.description: The unique session ID provided by the WhatsApp Business API.

startTime.description: The start time of the WhatsApp session.

endTime.description: The end time of the WhatsApp session (if applicable).

messages.description: A log of messages exchanged during the WhatsApp session (e.g., JSON string of message objects).

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure prioritizes authorization independence and QAPs (Rules are not Filters). User-owned data (ChannelAccounts, ContentIdeas, WhatsAppSessions) are stored under `/users/{userId}` to simplify ownership-based security rules. This eliminates the need for complex `get()` calls in security rules and enables atomic operations.  Subscriptions are stored in a top-level collection to support global queries and simplify subscription-based feature gating.

Authorization Independence is achieved via path-based ownership for private user data. For example, content ideas are stored under `/users/{userId}/contentIdeas/{contentIdeaId}` which allows security rules to simply check `request.auth.uid == userId`. No data needs to be read to determine authorization.  No membership maps are required as all user-owned data follows the `/users/{userId}` structure. All collections of user data leverage path-based ownership, ensuring authorization rules can be written based solely on the path and `request.auth.uid`.

QAPs are supported via structural segregation. Public data (TrendEvents, Keywords, Competitors) is stored in top-level collections, allowing secure list operations without complex filtering logic in security rules. User-specific data is segregated under the `/users/{userId}` path, enabling secure listing of user-owned entities.
